today_in_history_posts.title: Selfish Mining Prevention
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Selfish mining involves miners colluding to deliberately mine with a lower hashrate.
- A proposed solution adjusts block rewards based on the relationship between current and peak hashrates.
- Adjusting for selfish mining might require a dynamic difficulty adjustment algorithm and considerations for a future fee market.

today_in_history_posts.title: Measuring centrality of nodes in LN graph
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Kulpreet Singh explores measuring node centrality in the Lightning Network for better routing.
- He uses methodologies from Freeman's and Tarjan's papers to assess nodes and central point dominance.
- His initial findings are shared on Medium, inviting feedback for further directed graph analysis.

today_in_history_posts.title: Combined CTV/APO into minimal TXHASH+CSFS
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The author updated a proposal on bitcoin-dev, debating its significance and seeking feedback.
- The document outlines similarities and differences between CTV and APO in Bitcoin's protocol.
- It aims to enhance understanding of Bitcoin's technical progress through comparison.
